title: U.S., Other Countries to Tap Strategic Oil Reserves in Bid to Tame Inflation
sub_head: Coordinated release seeks to ease gasoline prices, White House says
body:
WASHINGTONâ€”The U.S. and several other countries will tap their national strategic petroleum reserves, senior Biden administration officials said Tuesday, in an attempt to bring down gasoline prices that have become a big contributor to inflation.
Other countries participating in the release include China, India, Japan, South Korea and the U.K., the White House said. The U.S. will release 50 million barrels, officials said.
